page.title: 06Housing, types and materials
page.content: There is a great variety of housing in our block.Much of it is{Victorian}or even older.There are quite a number of {farms}both tennanted and private and many{tied cottages}most of which are owned by{Lord Hotham}who lives at Dalton Hall.The three villages contain a mixture of old and modern houses and small council estates.Mostly the pattern is ribbon development with very little infill.The modern building is of{brick}with{pantile}roofs.Much of the older housing is of brick and tile also but there are many buildings made from{chalk}which is found locally.The chalk is not very good for building as it is porous and the frost can crack the blocks.
